attachments.title: Projecting the transmission dynamics of SARS-CoV-2 through the postpandemic period
attachments.text: It is urgent to understand the future of severe acute respiratory syndrome–coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) transmission. We used estimates of seasonality, immunity, and cross-immunity for betacoronaviruses OC43 and HKU1 from time series data from the USA to inform a model of SARS-CoV-2 transmission. We projected that recurrent wintertime outbreaks of SARS-CoV-2 will probably occur after the initial, most severe pandemic wave. Absent other interventions, a key metric for the success of social distancing is whether critical care capacities are exceeded. To avoid this, prolonged or intermittent social distancing may be necessary into 2022. Additional interventions, including expanded critical care capacity and an effective therapeutic, would improve the success of intermittent distancing and hasten the acquisition of herd immunity. Longitudinal serological studies are urgently needed to determine the extent and duration of immunity to SARS-CoV-2. Even in the event of apparent elimination, SARS-CoV-2 surveillance should be maintained since a resurgence in contagion could be possible as late as 2024.
attachments.fallback: Science: Projecting the transmission dynamics of SARS-CoV-2 through the postpandemic period

text:
An incredible piece of work and simulation of social distancing, seasonality and cross immunity with other corona viruses.  It paints a very bleak picture.

What I find hard to explain is the complete absence of analysis of the comparative data, in particular, the exponential growth coefficients between the neighboring countries of Czech, Austria and Germany where mask adoption rates are quite different.

The wearing of masks has an order of magnitude less disruptive effect on economic activity compared to social distancing 

Speculating about future mitigation strategies, the wearing of masks could be like mask wearing against air pollution with a virus threat level being announced every three days

The seasonal recurrence scenarios are so dire, it makes sense that investment in medical engineering technology to achieve personal virus source control to an extent sufficient to achieve reduction of R zero levels low enough that a new wave quickly peters out

Please comment to all of the above so that we can prepare a commentary to the authors
